column1: #Text=the Federal surplus is built on restraining money flowing to the provinces to cover such things as health care (for which Harper conveniently announced a fixed rate of increases in Federal transfers) and, in effect, said, 'Any increases above the rate of inflation for health care is your problem.'
#Text=Funny how the Conservatives still castigate Paul Martin for 'balancing the books on the back of the provinces', isn't it?
#Text=Pity we aren't having discussions about the points raised in this column, isn't it?
